info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 02 at 9:23PM CDT until May 02 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR FRANKLIN...EASTERN CRAWFORD AND NORTHEASTERN SEBASTIAN COUNTIES... At 922 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles east of Mulberry, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Ozark... Lavaca... Mulberry... Dyer... Altus... Wiederkehr Village... Cass... Fern... Jethro... Barnes... Redding... Watalula... Piney... Toney... Turners Bend... Vesta... Cecil... Lonelm... Taft... Ursula... This includes Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 16 and 42. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
